alert.note: Alert for Cerro Gordo; Emmet; Hancock; Kossuth; Winnebago; Worth (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:29PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Emmet, western Worth, Kossuth, northern Hancock, northwestern Cerro Gordo and Winnebago Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 829 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Elmore, or 19 miles northwest of Forest City, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Locations impacted include... Mason City, Algona, Forest City, Garner, Lake Mills, Britt, Emmons, Union Slogh, Eagle Lake, Mason City Municipal Airport, Rice Lake, Clear Lake, Buffalo Center, Bancroft, Ventura, Swea City, Burt, Thompson, Titonka and Ringsted. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 195 and 214. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cerro Gordo; Emmet; Hancock; Kossuth; Winnebago; Worth
